form.preferredDefinition: The individual stands against the wall with his or her arms outstretched at shoulder level. Measurement of the arm span is the maximum distance between the extended middle fingers of the right and left hands, measured across the back.

module.longName: This protocol is part of an examination survey. It requires a tape measure at least 2 m long, a flat surface (usually a wall), and an adjustable block that is fixed to the wall. The spool of the tape measure is fixed to the adjustable block. The block serves as the contact point for the middle (longest) finger of the right hand, which is in contact with the block when the participant is positioned. The block must be movable so that it can be adjusted vertically to accommodate individuals of varying stature. The block is adjusted to bring the tape to the shoulder level for the subject, and then the tape is pulled horizontally along the wall. The participant stands with the feet together so that his or her back is against the wall. The arms are outstretched laterally and maximally at the level of the shoulders, in contact with the wall, and with the palms facing forward. The tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the right hand is kept in contact with the block, while the zero end of the tape is set at the tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the left hand. Two people (measurers) are necessary, one at the zero end of the tape to be sure the tape end is positioned correctly and the other at the block end to make the reading. The measurement is recorded to the nearest 0.1 cm (1/4"). Occasionally, a small stool may be required for the measurers to make this measurement on tall subjects (when the measurer is shorter than the study subject). When making this measurement, it is imperative that the participant's arms be outstretched maximally and that they are held in this position until the reading is taken. Special care must be taken with young children and older individuals as they tend to lower their arms during the measurement.* Please note that there might be high levels of participant discomfort (see Burden Table) for the elderly and young children who may not be as flexible.
module.preferredDefinition: This protocol is part of an examination survey. It requires a tape measure at least 2 m long, a flat surface (usually a wall), and an adjustable block that is fixed to the wall. The spool of the tape measure is fixed to the adjustable block. The block serves as the contact point for the middle (longest) finger of the right hand, which is in contact with the block when the participant is positioned. The block must be movable so that it can be adjusted vertically to accommodate individuals of varying stature. The block is adjusted to bring the tape to the shoulder level for the subject, and then the tape is pulled horizontally along the wall. The participant stands with the feet together so that his or her back is against the wall. The arms are outstretched laterally and maximally at the level of the shoulders, in contact with the wall, and with the palms facing forward. The tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the right hand is kept in contact with the block, while the zero end of the tape is set at the tip of the middle (longest) finger (excluding the fingernail) of the left hand. Two people (measurers) are necessary, one at the zero end of the tape to be sure the tape end is positioned correctly and the other at the block end to make the reading. The measurement is recorded to the nearest 0.1 cm (1/4"). Occasionally, a small stool may be required for the measurers to make this measurement on tall subjects (when the measurer is shorter than the study subject). When making this measurement, it is imperative that the participant's arms be outstretched maximally and that they are held in this position until the reading is taken. Special care must be taken with young children and older individuals as they tend to lower their arms during the measurement.* Please note that there might be high levels of participant discomfort (see Burden Table) for the elderly and young children who may not be as flexible.

question.questionText: Arm Span measured in centimeter, first measurement. (arm_span_1)
Arm Span measured in centimeter, second measurement (arm_span_2)

Arm Span measured in centimeter, third measurement. A third measurement should be taken if the first two measurements differed by greater than1.0 cm (1/4") for participants 12 years or older or greater than0.5 cm (1/8") for participants 11 years and younger. (arm_span_3)

Average Arm Span measurement. If it is necessary to take a third measurement, the two closest measurements are averaged. Should the third measurement fall equally between the first two measurements, all three should be averaged. (arm_span_average)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The individual stands against the wall with his or her arms outstretched at shoulder level. Measurement of the arm span is the maximum distance between the extended middle fingers of the right and left hands, measured across the back.

form.preferredDefinition: The Scale for the Assessment and Rating of Ataxia (SARA) is a clinical scale used to assess cerebellar ataxia. The scale includes 8 items that are related to gait, stance, sitting, speech, finger-chase test, nose-finger test, fast alternating movements and heel-shin test. A trained physician observes the participant perform these physical function tests and gives each one a value from the scale.

question.questionText: Proband is asked (1) to walk at a safe distance parallel to a wall including a halfturn (turn around to face the opposite direction of gait) and (2) to walk in tandem (heels to toes) without support. Score _______ (ataxia_proband_gait)

validValue.meaningText: Normal, no difficulties in walking, turning and walking tandem (up to one misstep allowed)
validValue.description: Normal, no difficulties in walking, turning and walking tandem (up to one misstep allowed)

validValue.meaningText: Slight difficulties, only visible when walking 10 consecutive steps in tandem
validValue.description: Slight difficulties, only visible when walking 10 consecutive steps in tandem

validValue.meaningText: Clearly abnormal, tandem walking >10 steps not possible
validValue.description: Clearly abnormal, tandem walking >10 steps not possible

validValue.meaningText: Considerable staggering, difficulties in half-turn, but without support
validValue.description: Considerable staggering, difficulties in half-turn, but without support

validValue.meaningText: Marked staggering, intermittent support of the wall required
validValue.description: Marked staggering, intermittent support of the wall required

validValue.meaningText: Severe staggering, permanent support of one stick or light support by one arm required
validValue.description: Severe staggering, permanent support of one stick or light support by one arm required

validValue.meaningText: Walking > 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)
validValue.description: Walking > 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)

validValue.meaningText: Walking < 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)
validValue.description: Walking < 10 m only with strong support (two special sticks or stroller or accompanying person)

question.questionText: Proband is asked to stand (1) in natural position, (2) with feet together in parallel (big toes touching each other) and (3) in tandem (both feet on one line, no space between heel and toe). Proband does not wear shoes, eyes are open. For each condition, three trials are allowed. Best trial is rated. Score __________ (ataxia_proband_stance)

validValue.meaningText: Normal, able to stand in tandem for > 10 s
validValue.description: Normal, able to stand in tandem for > 10 s

validValue.meaningText: Able to stand with feet together without sway, but not in tandem for > 10s
validValue.description: Able to stand with feet together without sway, but not in tandem for > 10s

validValue.meaningText: Able to stand with feet together for > 10 s, but only with sway
validValue.description: Able to stand with feet together for > 10 s, but only with sway

validValue.meaningText: Able to stand for > 10 s without support in natural position but not with feet together
validValue.description: Able to stand for > 10 s without support in natural position but not with feet together

validValue.meaningText: Able to stand for >10 s in natural position only with intermittent support
validValue.description: Able to stand for >10 s in natural position only with intermittent support

validValue.meaningText: Able to stand >10 s in natural position only with constant support of one arm
validValue.description: Able to stand >10 s in natural position only with constant support of one arm

validValue.meaningText: Unable to stand for >10 s even with constant support of one arm
validValue.description: Unable to stand for >10 s even with constant support of one arm

question.questionText: Proband is asked to sit on an examination bed without support of feet, eyes open and arms outstretched to the front. Score _____________ (ataxia_proband_sitting)

validValue.meaningText: Constant sway, but able to sit > 10 s without support
validValue.description: Constant sway, but able to sit > 10 s without support

validValue.meaningText: Able to sit for > 10 s only with intermittent support
validValue.description: Able to sit for > 10 s only with intermittent support

validValue.meaningText: Unable to sit for >10 s without continuous support
validValue.description: Unable to sit for >10 s without continuous support

question.questionText: Speech is assessed during normal conversation. (ataxia_speech_disturbance)

validValue.meaningText: Impaired speech, but easy to understand
validValue.description: Impaired speech, but easy to understand

question.questionText: Rated separately for each side Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Examiner sits in front of proband and performs 5 consecutive sudden and fast pointing movements in unpredictable directions in a frontal plane, at about 50 % of proband's reach. Movements have an amplitude of 30 cm and a frequency of 1 movement every 2 s. Proband is asked to follow the movements with his index finger, as fast and precisely as possible. Average performance of last 3 movements is rated. Score Right ___________ (ataxia_finger_chase_right_side)

Rated separately for each side Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Examiner sits in front of proband and performs 5 consecutive sudden and fast pointing movements in unpredictable directions in a frontal plane, at about 50 % of proband's reach. Movements have an amplitude of 30 cm and a frequency of 1 movement every 2 s. Proband is asked to follow the movements with his index finger, as fast and precisely as possible. Average performance of last 3 movements is rated. Score Left: ____________ (ataxia_finger_chase_left_side)
Mean of both sides (R+L)/2:______________ (ataxia_finger_chase_mean_both_sides)

Rated separately for each side Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to point repeatedly with his index finger from his nose to examiner's finger which is in front of the proband at about 90 % of proband's reach. Movements are performed at moderate speed. Average performance of movements is rated according to the amplitude of the kinetic tremor. Score Right: ______________ (ataxia_nose_finger_right_side)

Rated separately for each side Proband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to point repeatedly with his index finger from his nose to examiner's finger which is in front of the proband at about 90 % of proband's reach. Movements are performed at moderate speed. Average performance of movements is rated according to the amplitude of the kinetic tremor. Score Left: _______________ (ataxia_nose_finger_left_side)
Mean of both sides (R+L)/2:______________ (ataxia_nose_finger_mean_both_sides)

Rated separately for each side roband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to perform 10 cycles of repetitive alternation of pro and supinations of possible. Movement is demonstrated by examiner at a speed of approx. 10 cycles within 7 s. Exact times for movement execution have to be taken. Score Right: ___________ (ataxia_fast_alternating_hand_movement_right)

validValue.meaningText: Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s
validValue.description: Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s

validValue.meaningText: Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s
validValue.description: Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s

question.questionText: Rated separately for each side roband sits comfortably. If necessary, support of feet and trunk is allowed. Proband is asked to perform 10 cycles of repetitive alternation of pro and supinations of possible. Movement is demonstrated by examiner at a speed of approx. 10 cycles within 7 s. Exact times for movement execution have to be taken. Score Left: ___________ (ataxia_fast_alternating_hand_movement_left)

validValue.meaningText: Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s
validValue.description: Clearly irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, but performs <10s

validValue.meaningText: Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s
validValue.description: Very irregular, single movements difficult to distinguish or relevant interruptions, performs >10s

question.questionText: Mean of both sides (R+L)/2:______________ (ataxia_fast_alternating_handmovement_mean)

Rated separately for each side roband lies on examination bed, without sight of his legs. Proband is asked to lift one leg, point with the heel to the opposite knee, slide down along the shin to the ankle, and lay the leg back on the examination bed. The task is performed 3 times. Slidedown movements should be performed within 1 s. If proband slides down without contact to shin in all three trials, rate 'Unable to perform the task'. Score Right:_____________ (ataxia_heel_shin_slide_right)

validValue.meaningText: Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained
validValue.description: Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained

validValue.meaningText: Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles
validValue.description: Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles

validValue.meaningText: Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles
validValue.description: Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles

question.questionText: Rated separately for each side roband lies on examination bed, without sight of his legs. Proband is asked to lift one leg, point with the heel to the opposite knee, slide down along the shin to the ankle, and lay the leg back on the examination bed. The task is performed 3 times. Slidedown movements should be performed within 1 s. If proband slides down without contact to shin in all three trials, rate 'Unable to perform the task'. Score Left:_____________ (ataxia_heel_shin_slide_left)

validValue.meaningText: Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained
validValue.description: Slightly abnormal, contact to shin maintained

validValue.meaningText: Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles
validValue.description: Clearly abnormal, goes off shin up to 3 times during 3 cycles

validValue.meaningText: Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles
validValue.description: Severely abnormal, goes off shin 4 or more times during 3 cycles

question.questionText: Mean of both sides (R+L)/2:______________ (ataxia_heel_shin_slide_mean)
[Calculated score] Mean values from each one of the eight items are summed to obtain the total score. The total scores range from 0 (no ataxia) to 40 (severe ataxia). (ataxia_total_score2_752)

protocol.preferredDefinition: The Scale for the Assessment and Rating of Ataxia (SARA) is a clinical scale used to assess cerebellar ataxia. The scale includes 8 items that are related to gait, stance, sitting, speech, finger-chase test, nose-finger test, fast alternating movements and heel-shin test. A trained physician observes the participant perform these physical function tests and gives each one a value from the scale.

form.longName: PhenX PX020201 - Birth Weight Abstracted From Medical Records
form.preferredDefinition: Birth weight abstracted from medical charts or perinatal databases or as reported in vital records

module.longName: Birth Weight Abstracted From Medical Records
module.preferredDefinition: Birth Weight Abstracted From Medical Records

question.questionText: Weight in gram (weight_in_gram)
Newborn birth weight abstracted from the medical record/vital record, in gram (medical_record_birthwt_g)
Newborn birth weight abstracted from the medical record/vital record, in pound (medical_record_birthwt_lb)
Newborn birth weight abstracted from the medical record/vital record, in ounce (medical_record_birthwt_oz)

protocol.longName: Birth Weight - Birth Weight Abstracted from Medical Records
protocol.preferredDefinition: Birth weight abstracted from medical charts or perinatal databases or as reported in vital records

question.questionText: How much did participant weigh at birth? ENTER WEIGHT IN GRAMS OR POUNDS AND OUNCES (proxy_birthwt_gram)
How much did {you/[participant]} weigh at birth in grams? (proxy_report_birthwt_g)
How much did {you/[participant]} weigh at birth in pounds? (proxy_reported_birthweight_pounds)
How much did {you/[participant]} weigh at birth in ounces? (proxy_reported_birthweight_ounces)
Did {you/[participant]} weigh ...? (proxy_reported_birthweight_2500g)
Did {you/[participant]} weigh ...? (proxy_reported_birthweight_4100g)

protocol.longName: Birth Weight - Proxy Reported Birth Weight
